taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section arguti;species pauper;

treatment.description: Differing from no. 197 in its often mounding and prostrate or ascending canes only 2-3 mm. in diameter; leaflets very sharply serrate and sharp-tipped, the terminal primocane-leaflet narrowly ovate and much longer than broad. (Incl. plants of various habits but probably phases of one species: R. humilior and polulus Bailey)
